alert.note: Alert for Chesterfield; Kershaw; Lancaster (South Carolina) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Severe Thunderstorm Warning issued May 06 at 6:29PM EDT until May 06 at 7:00PM EDT by NWS Columbia
info.description: The National Weather Service in Columbia has issued a * Severe Thunderstorm Warning for... Lancaster County in central South Carolina... Northwestern Chesterfield County in central South Carolina... Northwestern Kershaw County in central South Carolina... * Until 700 PM EDT. * At 629 PM EDT, a severe thunderstorm was located near Heath Springs, or 11 miles southeast of Lancaster, moving northeast at 70 mph. HAZARD...Ping pong ball size hail and 60 mph wind gusts. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...People and animals outdoors will be injured. Expect hail damage to roofs, siding, windows, and vehicles. Expect wind damage to trees and powerlines. * Locations impacted include... Lancaster, Pageland, Kershaw, Elgin, Heath Springs, USC Lancaster, Irwin, Buford, Jefferson, Bell Town Fire Station, Arrowood Estates, Faith Christian School, Bear Creek Park, Central High School, McDonald Green Elementary School, High Point Fire Station, Tradesville, Camp Creek Fire Station, Antioch and Kirk Air Base. HAIL THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX HAIL SIZE...1.50 IN WIND THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX WIND GUST...60 MPH
info.instruction: A Tornado Watch remains in effect until 800 PM EDT for central South Carolina. For your protection seek shelter inside a sturdy building and stay away from windows. A Tornado Watch remains in effect until 800 PM EDT for central South Carolina.
